data.text: Any Reviews of the New Marin Nicasio+?
Anyone have experience with these? Marin Nicasio+. Seems like a tempting candidate, my favourite frame material, loads of attachment points and most importantly available locally and in stock.
Used to sell those at the old shop i worked for. Pretty solid for the money. Components levels are component levels regardless of the brand but the frames were nice.
data.author: Scott Lomas

data.text: The spec wasn't to bad, only thing I think I would change is swapping out the breaks for hydraulics, and putting Galfer discs and pad on it
data.author: Espen Solvang

data.text: I have a 4 Corners. Not a Nicasio but the fit and finish of my steel framed Marin is top notch. Really solid.
data.author: Lee Veinotte

data.text: I own one. I love it. I really like the micro shift advent drivetrain. I think it‚Äôs a comfy and capable bike

data.text: Mine shifts super crisp and even when riding blue and black diamond singletrack I never dropped a chain. Though I never rode with the stock front chainring and chain length. I have a few bikes and it shifts as well as my Shimano Eagle GX.
